info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 05 at 6:33PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...THUNDERSTORMS WITH VERY HEAVY RAINFALL WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN UNION COUNTY UNTIL 730 PM EDT... At 632 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a series of thunderstorms producing very heavy rainfall across southwest Union County, moving east at 10 mph. Locations to be impacted include... Monroe, Waxhaw, Mineral Springs, Wesley Chapel, Unionville, Jaars and Trinity. Very heavy rainfall rates up to 2 inches per hour will be possible in these areas.
info.instruction: Very heavy rainfall may flood areas with poor drainage, such as ditches and underpasses. Avoid these areas and do not cross flooded roads. Water levels of small streams may also rise rapidly. Seek higher ground if threatened by flood waters.
